definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: Ecogeographical regionalization is the basis for spatial differentiation of biodiversity research.
sentences.chinese: 生態地理區劃是生物多樣性研究的空間分異基礎。

sentences.english: The second period's gabbronorite facies is poorly differentiated.
sentences.chinese: 第二侵入期輝長蘇長巖相分異程度低。

sentences.english: Crystallization differentiation for granite is the main diagenesis mode.
sentences.chinese: 結晶分異作用爲花崗岩的主要成巖方式。

sentences.english: The primitive material of the Earth were the differentiated iron meteorites and H chondrites.
sentences.chinese: 地球的初始物質爲分異的鐵隕石及H羣球粒隕石。

sentences.english: The deviation analysis of spatial-temporal structure is based on GIS overlay.
sentences.chinese: 時空結構分異分析是以GIS疊置分析爲輔助手段。
